metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9497 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow in mpg123 before 1.18.0. It was discovered that mpg123 incorrectly handled certain media files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9497` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmpg123-0 - 1.16.0-1ubuntu1.1
mpg123 - 1.16.0-1ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mpg123 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.16.0-1ubuntu1.1').
